result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E Olds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Any unpaid fines to be paid with 25% of any prison wages/funds that the defendant may be entitled to. Assessment from count #1 on this case also paid thru ES on count #3 on this case ($584.50).
Concurrent with: Counts #1 and #2 on 13CF124.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian E Olds in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Brian E Olds in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the Forest, County of. Called at 11:18 AM. Called 13CF124, 14CF03, 15CM100, 16CF63 and 16CF64. State - here for sentencing after revocation on 14CF03 and 13CF124 and here for sentencing hearing on 15CM100, 16CF63 and 16CF64. Voorhees and Olds have revocation summary packet and does not see any inaccuracies. Court notes that the revocation summary is recommending a lengthy term of incarceration - preferrably in prison. Court needs moment to review charges (11:24 AM). State has complied with victim notification requirements with no response. State - summarizes the defendant's criminal history prior to final argument for sentencing - 13CF124 - recommends #1 - 8 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of ES, #2 - 3.5 in WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to count #1; 14CF03 - #3 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to 13CF124; 15CM100 - 90 days jail on each count - concurrent to each other and to 13CF124; 16CF63 - counts #1 and #2 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to each other but consecutive to 14CF03 and 13CF124; 16CF64 - #2 - 2 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year of ES - consecutive to 13CF124, and on counts #3, #5 and #10 - 9 months on each count concurrent to each and to 16CF63 but consecutive to 14CF03 and 13CF124, asking that any restitution/costs be paid by garnishing any of his prison wages/income that he is entitled to. Voorhees makes final argument prior to sentencing recommendation - 13CF124 - calculates jail credit of 444 days  - asking court to consider time served on this case and asks Court to structure any more incarceration time on the new cases, not the revocation cases, calculates 226 days credit on 14CF03 (State stiplulates to defense counsels representation of the facts in 16CF64 and no need to play video - Court agrees) - asking court to not order sex offender registration for stated reasons - recommends a modest period of confinement time and consider consecutive probation on 16CF63 case and an imposed and stayed sentence. Olds makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: Recess until 1:00 PM. Recalled at 1:08 with same appearances. Voorhees makes additional statement in regards to sentences - State is recommending a consecutive prison sentence on the three cases that are being sentenced today. Court comes up with 5.5 years in prison and 6 years of ES, believes that 136CF124, 14CF03 and 15CM100 are concurrent and 16CF63 and 16CF64 are concurrent to each other but consecutive to 13CF124. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 13CF124 - count #1 - 6 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, count #2 - 3.5 with 1.5 in and 2 out - concurrent to count #1; 14CF03 - 6 years with 3 in and 3 out - concurrent to counts #1 and #2 on 13CF124; 15CM100 - #3 - 9 months in FC jail and #4 - 9 months in jail - concurrent to each other and to time on 14CF03 and 13CF124; 16CF63 - count #1 - 3.5 years with 1.5 in and 2 out - consecutive to time on 13CF124 and 14CF03 and 15CM100, #2 - 3.5 years with 1.5 in and 2 out - concurrent to count #1; 16CF64 - count #2 - 2 years with 1 in and 1 out - concurrent to time on 16CF63, counts #3, #5 and #10 - 9 months on each count - concurrent to count #1 and concurrent to counts #1 and #2 on 16CF63 and to 13CF124, 14CF03 and 15CM100; any unpaid fines to be paid as condition of ES with other conditions of ES on other counts include:costs - paid thru 25% of any wages/funds he is entitled to, no consumption of alcohol, restitution if submitted, credit for 444 days on 13CF124 (stipulated) - also same credit given on 14CF03 and 15CM100, not eligible for programs, finds crime was sexually motivated but not ordering sex offender registration (16CF63), submit DNA sample with expungement rights given, no possession of firearms, no voting rights. Voorhees believes the defendant is entitled to 226 days credit on 14CF03. Court reviews. Stgate will stipulate to credit as stated by Voorhees. Court - 14CF03 - 226 days credit (stipulated), right to appeal, adjourned at 1:46 PM. Back on record at 1:49 PM, same appearances. Voorhees makes clarification on sentencing and credit. Court believes the credit has been ordered correctly. Adjourned at 1:52 PM.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brian E Olds in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Brian E Olds in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the Forest, County of. Called at 2:18 PM. Called 15CM100, 16CF64, 16CF63, 14CF03, 16CF102, 16CF123 and 13CF124. State - makes statement in regards to setting matters for a sentencing hearing and only taking a plea today due victim notification requirements on case #'s 15CM100, 16CF23 and 16CF24; on 15CM100  - plead to counts #3 and #4 - 90 days jail on each count concurrent to each other and concurrent to any jail sentence he may receive on 16CF64 and 16CF63; 16CF63 - on both counts #1 and #2 - dismiss repeater enchancer, plead G to #1 and #2 after amended and DRI counts #3 and #4 - free to argue sentence; 16CF64 - plead to counts #2, #3, #5, #10, as alleged and remaining counts to be DRI - free to argue sentence. Voorhees and Olds agree and agree with the free to argue sentence. Court  - 16CF64 - DRI counts #1, #4, #6, #7, #8, #9, #11 and #12. Olds pleads NC to counts #2, #3, #5, and #10. Simono states that all felonies counts must have a G plea to them. Voorhees does recall that agreement and states that the defendant will plead G to those counts as previously stated (#2, #3, #5, and #10). Court - 16CF63 - DRI #3 and #4, amend count #1 to delete any repeater enhancements/allegation. Olds pleads G to count #1 as amended; 16CF63 - amends #2 to delete repeater enhancer. Olds pleads G to count #2 as amended. Court - 15CM100 - DRI counts #1 and #2, Olds plead G to counts #3 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire for 15CM100, 16CF63 and 16CF64, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Voorhees makes statement in regards to setting the matter for sentencing hearing, talks about victim notification requirements and sex offender registry component. Court responds, not committing itself either way on what he will order at sentencing. Neither party are asking for a PSI. Court not going to order PSI either. Court continues bond on these matters and sets all matters for SEH on 7/7/16 at 11:00 AM, backing up a JT. All matters will be set on same date and time.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Judge's information sent directly to him by P&P

Ca;lled at 11:59 PM. Brian Olds appears in person and in custody with attorney Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. Roley - resolved/ State - amend #1 to county ordinance of DC, $500 fine plus costs, #2 - DRI, #3 - plead as alleged, #4 - DRI, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA, anger management, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain absolute sobriety, 200 hours of community service. Roley and Olds agree. Court amends count #1 to county ordinance violation of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $500 plus costs totalling $834.50 (?) - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation on count #3. Court DRI #2 and #4. Olds pleads G to count #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Roley makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Olds withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, concurrent to current sentence, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 200 hours of community service, costs - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed - paid thru probation, credit for 4 days only if revoked, no possession of firearms and no voting rights, right to appeal.
Final pre-trial on March 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Called at 4:01 PM. Brian Olds appears in person and in custody with attorney Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. State - filed Information that mirrors complaint in anticipation of waiver. Court has waiver of PH form,. goes thru it, find the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Roley has Information, waives reading of it and will proceed to ARGN, enters G pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT on 3/26/14 at 10:00 AM.
Preliminary hearing on February 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 4:54 PM. Brian Olds appears in person and in custody without counsel. State appears by Charles Simomo. Olds thought he had Tom Roley for an attorney. State informs that he has never officially been appointed by SPD and Olds was then informed by the Court to contact SPD. Court continues bond, set for another PH on 2/5/14 at 3:00 PM.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 11:27 AM. Brian Olds appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. Roley handed criminal complaint in court and has not had a chance to go over it with the defendant, waives formal reading, requests PH and waives time limits. Court sets for PH on 1/29/14 at 3:00 PM, bond continued.
